com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface validateReship

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface validateReship

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document validateReship(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The validateReship API validates that the order lines passed in the input are valid for being reshipped.

    • Method Detail

      • validateReship

        org.w3c.dom.Document validateReship(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        The validateReship API validates that the order lines passed in the input are valid for being reshipped. The API performs the following validations for each order line:

        • The order line must have enough available quantity that has not already been reshipped. If there is not enough quantity, then ReshipMessage will be returned as NOT_ENUOGH_RESHIPPABLE_QTY
        • The ship date for the order line plus the minimum reship window must be in the past. If the current date falls within the minimum reship window, then ReshipMessage will be returned as NOT_BEYOND_RESHIP_WINDOW
        • There must be enough available quantity on hand, as determined by the findInventory API. This validation will not set ReshipMessage; instead this validation's result is indicated by the QuantityAvailableForReship attribute. This findInventory call will not be performed if the ReshipOrderLine element is not present in the API template.

        If the first or second conditions are not met, then the ReshipAllowed attribute will be returned as N in the output XML. The ReshipAllowed and ReshipMessage attributes are available at the line level, as well as at the header level as the consolidation of the order line values.

        Additional validation may be done by the YFSValidateReshipUE. This user exit may cause the API to return a different ReshipMessage from those listed above.

        If the order line is a bundle parent, then all the product components that maintain ratio are considered for computing quantity available for reship. API findInventory is called for these components to compute how much of bundle parent can be fulfilled. Components that do not maintain KitQty should be passed separately if they need to be re-shipped.

        The validateReship API will not return availability information for logical kits. Should logical kit processing be required, the YFSValidateReshipUE can be implemented. The ContainerKey, which can be passed through the API, can be used to determine which kit components need to be reshipped.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSValidateReshipUE - Invoked unconditionally if implemented.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that indicates if the order lines selected are valid for reshipping. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
